p: Density functional theory (DFT) calculations were performed in the gas phase on the neutral, oxidized and reduced forms of the molecule, using the Amsterdam Density Functional (ADF) 2016 programme [5]. Seven different functionals in combination with the TZP (Triple Î¶ polarized) basis set were used, namely: OLYP (Handy-Cohen and Lee-Yang-Parr) [6], [7], [8], [9], B3LYP [7], [10], B3LYP* [11], O3LYP [12], BLYP [7], [8], [9], [13], BP86 [13], [14] and M06-L [15], [16]]. Input coordinates were constructed theoretically, using ChemCraft [17]. ChemCraft was also used to visualize the ADF output files. Experimental crystal structural data was obtained using ConQuest Version 1.21, to search for existing [Cu II(acac) 2] crystal structures in the Cambridge Structural Database [4]. The optimized coordinates, as well as an example input file, are provided in the supplementary information.
